subject: Re: [junit] Ant and Junit
msgSnippet: ... How do you know it isn t executing that line?  Are things just running slower in Eclipse such that the interval you have chosen to sleep is small enough to
messageBody:
On Monday 17 May 2004 05:09 pm, boyfrnd007 wrote:
> Hi I have written this junit test where one of the tests uses the
> Thread.sleep method to sleep for a while. When I use the eclipse
> plugin to run the test, it seems to be working just fine. But when I
> use the ANT, it says the BUILD failed and it does not execute the
> Thread.sleep line in one of the tests. Does anyone know why is it
> doing that? Any help on this matter would be really appreciated.

How do you know it isn't executing that line? Are things just running slower
in Eclipse such that the interval you have chosen to sleep is small enough to
do the job, and outside Eclipse you need to have a bigger interval?

--
Jason Rogers

"Where there is no vision, the people perish..."
Proverbs 29:18
